API reference¶

Models¶

Note

The abstract baseclass BaseModel defines a few methods for retrieving information about the current state of the fit. These methods are not documented in the child classes, but will be regularly used.

satlas.basemodel.BaseModel() Abstract baseclass for all models, such as HFSModel, CombinedModel and MultiModel.
satlas.hfsmodel.HFSModel(I, J, ABC, centroid) Constructs a HFS spectrum, consisting of different peaks described by a certain profile.
satlas.multimodel.MultiModel(models) Create a spectrum containing the information of multiple hyperfine structures.
satlas.combinedmodel.CombinedModel(models) Combines different models for simultaneous fitting.

Fitting routines¶

satlas.fitting.calculate_analytical_uncertainty(f, x, y) Calculates the analytical errors on the parameters, by changing the value for a parameter and finding the point where the chisquare for the refitted parameters is one greater.
satlas.fitting.chisquare_fit(f, x, y, yerr) Use a non-linear least squares minimization (Levenberg-Marquardt) algorithm to minimize the chi-square of the fit to data x and y with errorbars yerr.
satlas.fitting.chisquare_model(params, f, x, ...) Model function for chisquare fitting routines as established in this module.
satlas.fitting.chisquare_spectroscopic_fit(f, x, y) Use the chisquare_fit function, automatically estimating the errors on the counts by the square root.
satlas.fitting.likelihood_fit(f, x, y[, ...]) Fits the given model to the given data using the Maximum Likelihood Estimation technique.
satlas.fitting.likelihood_walk(f, x, y[, ...]) Calculates the uncertainty on MLE-optimized parameter values by performing a random walk through parameter space and comparing the resulting loglikelihood values.
satlas.fitting.likelihood_x_err(f, x, y, ...) Calculates the loglikelihood for a model given x and y values.
satlas.fitting.likelihood_lnprob(params, f, ...) Calculates the logarithm of the probability that the data fits the model given the current parameters.
satlas.fitting.likelihood_loglikelihood(f, ...) Given a parameters object, a Model object, experimental data and a loglikelihood function, calculates the loglikelihood for all data points.

Lineshapes¶

Implementation of classes for different lineshapes, creating callables for easy and intuitive calculations.

satlas.profiles.Crystalball([fwhm, mu, amp, ...]) A callable Crystalball profile.
satlas.profiles.Gaussian([fwhm, mu, amp, ...]) A callable normalized Gaussian profile.
satlas.profiles.Lorentzian([fwhm, mu, amp, ...]) A callable normalized Lorentzian profile.
satlas.profiles.Voigt([fwhm, mu, amp, ampIsArea]) A callable normalized Voigt profile.

Utilities¶

Implementation of various functions that ease the work, but do not belong in one of the other modules.

satlas.utilities.generate_correlation_plot(...) Given the random walk data, creates a triangle plot: distribution of a single parameter on the diagonal axes, 2D contour plots with 1, 2 and 3 sigma contours on the off-diagonal.
satlas.utilities.generate_correlation_map(f, ...) Generates a correlation map for either the chisquare or the MLE method.
satlas.utilities.generate_spectrum(spectrum, ...) Generates a model by random sampling from the provided HFSModel and range.
satlas.utilities.load_model(path) Loads the saved BaseModel and returns the reconstructed object.
satlas.utilities.poisson_interval(data[, alpha]) Calculates the confidence interval for the mean of a Poisson distribution.
satlas.utilities.weighted_average(x, sigma) Takes the weighted average of an array of values and the associated errors.
